article.headline: Pacific 78, Long Beach State 72
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Christian Maraker and Johnny Gray each scored 20 points Friday, and Maraker had 10 rebounds, as Pacific defeated Long Beach State 78-72 in a Big West Conference basketball game. Gray scored 11 points down the stretch, including four free throws in the final 1:10 to lead a Tigers' comeback. Maraker recorded his ninth double-double of the season, as the Tigers outrebounded the 49ers 43-34. Aaron Nixon scored 17 points and Kejuan Johnson added 15 for the 49ers (6-8, 1-2). Pacific (11-5, 2-1) has now won four of five and defeated the 49ers five consecutive times dating to February 2003. It looked like that streak was about to end with the Tigers trailing 64-58 with 6:30 remaining, but then Pacific went on a 20-8 run. The Tigers had led 39-35 at halftime

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
